column5: It wasnt a biggn,but man do they fight.  I heeded the advise from my last post. Rod up high,let the rod do the fighting.For a little fella,he sure did put up a fight.AMAZING aerial jumps.I used my palm to controll the reel.I found this worked well for me.Oh, Im so hooked on these pink an orange worms. Who would of thunk it.
Congrats Brian!  Of all the fishing I do, I have to say that steelheading in tribs is the most satisfactory.  A beauty fish!
Great work Brian!  My first river bow was on a pinkie to... Although mine was borderline smolt... lol keep it up!
Sweet fishy Brian  Yesterday I was doing some steelhead sampling in your neck of the woods. I have to admit that even those small bows do fight well for their size.
Thanks guys   You should of said something.  It,s only going to get better.We have to hook up soon.  How did ya make out?
Good show Brian,I'll be heading out tomorrow morning:thumbsup_anim:

I didn't go home unsatisfied  ...But in some cases, the 5lb Maxima leaders I was using got violated by big, cartwheeling, tailwalking, logjam diving bars of steel in ways I never thought were possible
Beauty fish man
Glad you did well. I hate retying,logjams and down trees love my terminal tackle.LOL
Nice one B Congrats on your first
Nice fish! Anything special about those worms? Scented?
Berkley Gulp pink worms.The only ones I can find at CT.
I give.em a kiss and say,please catch me a fish.LOL  Davey answered your question.

sweet fish man!   you were using pink berkely worms? I never knew you could catch a steelhead with them! Do you just put them on a plain hook under a bobber? I have yet to catch a big steelhead like that guy but really want to get a few this winter
Brian, gotta work on that gill hold   I realize they are slippery buggers, get yourself a cotton glove or similar.  Makes it a lot easier to hold on to them.
I just hook the plate Bill.Never touch the gills.It swam away just as healthy as it was never caught.I hear ya. I have seen your pics along with others from here. Will do. Thanks.
That's awesome Brian.  She's a beaut

You can't help it if they head to a log jam, but I was once told if you aren't re-tying because of snags drifting in waters like that, you aren't doing it right lol.  I look forward to more steelhead reports from you Brian!
Nice job Brian !!  It sure was an awesome day to be out enjoying the outdoors.
Nice one doooood.  :thumbsup_anim:
Congrats!  Beauty fish
